citations.narrative:
Seven rabbits are housed, in two separate enclosures, in the workroom of the house. These two enclosures are
constructed with unsealed wood and wire. The rabbits, in both enclosures, are able to come into contact with the
unsealed walls and framework. The wooden surfaces should be sealed so that they are substantially impervious to
moisture. Unsealed surfaces could absorb urine and create odors that could affect the health of the rabbits housed
therein. These same unsealed surfaces cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized.
Facility should repair the surfaces so that they are substantially imperious to moisture.
The interior building surfaces of indoor housing facilities shall be constructed and maintained so that they are substantially
impervious to moisture and may be readily sanitized.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: NOVEM\BER 15, 2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility has chickens and ducks for exhibition. A written environment enhancement plan is not currently in place.
These birds must be provided with environment enhancement to enrich their housing environment and to promote their
psychological well-being. The written plan should be reviewed and approved by the attending veterinarian.
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the
attending veterinarian.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: NOVEMBER 22, 2023
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.51(d) 
   
Facilities, indoor. 
Seven rabbits are housed, in two separate enclosures, in the workroom of the house. These two enclosures are 
constructed with unsealed wood and wire. The rabbits, in both enclosures, are able to come into contact with the 
unsealed walls and framework. The wooden surfaces should be sealed so that they are substantially impervious to 
moisture. Unsealed surfaces could absorb urine and create odors that could affect the health of the rabbits housed 
therein. These same unsealed surfaces cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized. 
 
Facility should repair the surfaces so that they are substantially imperious to moisture. 
 
The interior building surfaces of indoor housing facilities shall be constructed and maintained so that they are substantially 
impervious to moisture and may be readily sanitized. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: NOVEM\BER 15, 2023

Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
